definition: to go through/to know well/(suffix) expert/to connect/to communicate/open/to clear/classifier for letters, telegrams, phone calls etc
classifier for an activity, taken in its entirety (tirade of abuse, stint of music playing, bout of drinking etc)
letter/mail/CL:封[feng1]/to trust/to believe/to profess faith in/truthful/confidence/trust/at will/at random
thread/string/wire/line/CL:條|条[tiao2],股[gu3],根[gen1]/(after a number) tier (unofficial ranking of a Chinese city)

sentences.english: The two-wire system is one of the widely used communication lines.
sentences.chinese: 二线制是运用最广泛的通信线路之一。

sentences.english: A technique for allowing simultaneous use of a communications line by two or more terminals.
sentences.chinese: 一种允许多个终端同时使用一条通信线的技术。

sentences.english: The shortwave radiocommunication between Antarctica and Beij- ing is the longest link at present time in China.
sentences.chinese: 南极北京是我国目前最长的短波通信线路之一。

sentences.english: The importance and representations of the reliabilities of optical fiber communication lines are discussed.
sentences.chinese: 本文叙述通信线路可靠性的重要性和各种表示方法。

sentences.english: Circuitry design and analysis must involve antenna gain in satellite communications.
sentences.chinese: 卫星通信线路的设计或分析一定涉及到天线增益。

sentences.english: The hiss came from an open comms line.
sentences.chinese: 的嘶嘶声来自一个开放的通信线。

sentences.english: The AC power lines and the telecommunication lines should be referenced together at the building entry point.
sentences.chinese: 在建筑物入口端，电源线和通信线应该连接一起接地。
